head.title: Free Meal Locations - Covid-19 - Waxahachie Independent School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Waxahachie Independent School District serves PreK-12th grade students and is located in Waxahachie, Texas.

li.a: Distance Learning for Students with Disabilities

p.span: The district is committed to providing food for all children needing meals during this time. Due to circumstances beyond our control, it is necessary to make modifications to our meal service program to combat dwindling available resources. The availability of necessary supplies like Styrofoam takeout containers and plastic bags to carry the containers are rapidly vanishing, and we are unable to locate a reliable source of replacement supplies. We are also experiencing a shrinking workforce that can prepare these meals due to various COVID-19 concerns. While the remote serving sites have shown a great need in our community for meals, our abilities to meet those needs have been stretched to a breaking point.
To ensure the long-term viability of our feeding program, we will return to campus-based foodservice operations beginning Monday, April 6. The campuses that will be serving food are:

div.span: We will continue serving meals on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Meal service times are 10 a.m.- noon at each site. Each child present will receive two breakfast meals and two lunch meals every Monday and Wednesday, and one breakfast meal and one lunch meal each Friday, as supplies last.

p.span: The Texas Department of Agriculture (TDA) has issued guidance stating weekend meals can no longer be served as part of this program. The above-listed sites are the only sites within Waxahachie ISD that will be serving meals to all children ages 1-18. Children must be present to receive a meal.

img.alt: man and woman holding sack lunches

a.span: Distance Learning for Students with Disabilities
